description.narrative: URU/13/G35 Fortalecimiento de la efectividad del Sistema Nacional de Áreas Protegidas incluyendo el enfoque de paisaje en la gestión”.
capital of a political entity
Protected area management integrated with adjacent landscapes

Area of forestry properties where design and management of setasides incorporate landscapewide BD considerations such as the size and spatial configuration of pasture areas in relation to vertical barriers such as forestry plantations and the spatial configuration condition and flowering seeding status of pasture grasses which determine the value of the setasides for pasture birds

comment.narrative: 188688ha of forestry plantation properties in target landscapes of which an estimated 15 is setasides 28303ha all of which are planned and managed on individual basis
50 of setasides 14152ha in forestry plantations in target landscapes are planned and managed in accordance with landscapewide considerations

SNAP participated with forestry producers and the academic sector in the cycle of workshops organized by the University of the Republic aimed to analyze the new exigencies of the standard FSC and identify new indicators for the national standard In addition SNAP and the Society of Forest Producers started the negotiations for the definition of a national protocol to identify areas of high value of conservation in forest plantations and the agreement on criteria for planning and management in such zones of conservation Indicator will be measured once the criteria for planning and management are agreed
50 of setasides 14152ha in forestry plantations in target landscapes are planned and managed in accordance with landscapewide considerations

SNAP participated with forestry producers and the academic sector in the cycle of workshops organized by the University of the Republic aimed to analyze the new exigencies of the standard FSC and identify new indicators for the national standard In addition SNAP and the Society of Forest Producers started the negotiations for the definition of a national protocol to identify areas of high value of conservation in forest plantations and the agreement on criteria for planning and management in such zones of conservation Indicator will be measured once the criteria for planning and management are agreed

description.narrative: Levels of staff assignment in Departmental governments for supporting integration of PA management with land use planning

comment.narrative: 3 of the 6 Departmental Governments covering the target areas have staff with specific responsibilities for planning and management of rural areas including those in or adjoining PAs

All 6 of the Departmental Governments covering the target areas Río Negro Paysandú Maldonado Rocha Rivera and Tacuarembó have staff with specific responsibilities for planning and management of rural areas including those in or adjoining PAs

Due to the change in departmental authorities on 2015 a new baseline will be created according to new situation on the second half of the year However the joint working agenda agreed with DINOT includes qualification training and technology transfer to departmental governments in order to support and promote the inclusion of more trained personnel in rural spatial planning processes

All 6 of the Departmental Governments covering the target areas Río Negro Paysandú Maldonado Rocha Rivera and Tacuarembó have staff with specific responsibilities for planning and management of rural areas including those in or adjoining PAs

Due to the change in departmental authorities on 2015 a new baseline will be created according to new situation on the second half of the year However the joint working agenda agreed with DINOT includes qualification training and technology transfer to departmental governments in order to support and promote the inclusion of more trained personnel in rural spatial planning processes

description.narrative: Effectiveness of mechanisms for stakeholder participation in planning and management

comment.narrative: CAEs exist in all three target PAs declared to date with broad participation but no mechanisms for feedback or evaluation of effectiveness and satisfaction

All 7 PAs to be included in the project have CAEs with functioning mechanisms for feedback and evaluation of effectiveness and satisfaction and CAEs receive consistent positive rating from stakeholder participants

The indicator will be measured towards the ending of 2015 This years goal all AP entered to SNAP prior to 2014 have formalized CAE See Annex Referencia metodológica para medición de indicadores del marco lógico The introduction of mechanisms for feedback and evaluation of the effectiveness and performance of the CAEs is planned for the year 2016

In 2014 the methodological process to measure this indicator was developed and the baseline created from 8 spatial plans approved and linked to the target zones 6 have some sort of reference to SNAP Indicators results for 2014 are Western littoral 25 North Canyons 0 Coastal lagoon 39 Total target areas 275 max 6 See Annex Referencia metodológica para medición de indicadores del marco lógico
In this period SNAP participated in the Strategic Environmental Evaluation carried out by DINAMA of Department Spatial Planning Guidelines Directrices Departamentales de Ordenamiento Territorial of Tacuarembó and Rio Negro As result both instruments incorporate specific contributions for including the landscape approach in spatial planning for conservation in target zones territories The indicator will be measured again in 2016

In this period SNAP participated in the Strategic Environmental Evaluation carried out by DINAMA of Department Spatial Planning Guidelines Directrices Departamentales de Ordenamiento Territorial of Tacuarembó and Rio Negro As result both instruments incorporate specific contributions for including the landscape approach in spatial planning for conservation in target zones territories The indicator will be measured again in 2016

description.narrative: Areas with public use and tourism plans in accordance with the national guidelines on tourism in protected areas currently being prepared

comment.narrative: None as the guidelines are still under preparation
To be determined

On August 2014 the Guidelines for Public Use in Protected Areas was approved by MINTUR and MVOTMA and the UNIT Rule for Sustainable Tourism in Protected Area was published
On June 2015 jointly with METT evaluation the planning process for the application of the tool Monitoring effectiveness of the public use foreknown on the guidelines has begun in order to establish the indicators baseline
To be determined

On August 2014 the Guidelines for Public Use in Protected Areas was approved by MINTUR and MVOTMA and the UNIT Rule for Sustainable Tourism in Protected Area was published
On June 2015 jointly with METT evaluation the planning process for the application of the tool Monitoring effectiveness of the public use foreknown on the guidelines has begun in order to establish the indicators baseline

A proposal to exclude the payment of the rural real estate tax land tax collected by local government to rural properties located in areas of minimum low or medium intervention regarding the Management Plan of a protected area was put forward for inclusion in the National Budget Law
The indicator will be measured annually from 2016

description.narrative: Amount of resources from Protected Area Fund received by SNAP

comment.narrative: Annual Operating Plan 2015 does not prioritize action lines regarding this objective The indicator will be measured annually from 2016
Annual Operating Plan 2015 does not prioritize action lines regarding this objective The indicator will be measured annually from 2016

description.narrative: Reduction in financial gap for SNAP

comment.narrative: Financial gap for SNAP as a whole 30 999000
20 reduction in financial gap for SNAP as a whole to 24 800000

During 2015 SNAPs budget was arranged for its inclusion in the fiveyear MVOTMA 20162020 budget Human resources and necessary founds for a basic management of the System were estimated taking into consideration the foreknown evolution of the SNAP physical network As well a proposal of tax incentives for privates to donate to the Protected Areas Fund was put forward for consideration of the parliament The fiveyear budget will be approved by the parliament on the last trimester of this year If the proposal is approved an additional source of funds may be available to finance the System
Results from these actions could be appreciated from 2016 on The indicator will be measured in 2016 and 2018
20 reduction in financial gap for SNAP as a whole to 24 800000

During 2015 SNAPs budget was arranged for its inclusion in the fiveyear MVOTMA 20162020 budget Human resources and necessary founds for a basic management of the System were estimated taking into consideration the foreknown evolution of the SNAP physical network As well a proposal of tax incentives for privates to donate to the Protected Areas Fund was put forward for consideration of the parliament The fiveyear budget will be approved by the parliament on the last trimester of this year If the proposal is approved an additional source of funds may be available to finance the System
Results from these actions could be appreciated from 2016 on The indicator will be measured in 2016 and 2018

description.narrative: Area of land in Laureles Cañas and Queguay with tax exemptions due to native forest cover

comment.narrative: None of the 6790ha native forest in Laureles and Queguay is declared for tax exemption
4074ha 60 of the native forest in Laureles and Queguay is declared for tax exemption

Required modifications for the agreement between MGAP and DINAMA associated to the native forest are being discussed in order to extend its enforcement in Laureles Cañas that is not a protected area registered in SNAP and therefore it is kept outside the agreement
The indicator will be measured annually from 2016
4074ha 60 of the native forest in Laureles and Queguay is declared for tax exemption

Institutionalized agreement in reference to criteria values and guidelines regarding biodiversity in planning process and environmental regulation did not exist until 2014 During 2015 a joint working agenda SNAPBiodiversity DivisionDINOT was agreed aimed to promote biodiversity and conservation mainstreaming in spatial planning tools Planned activities under this agreement include among others qualification training for DINOT and DINAMA staff and departmental technical staff and the update of the Guidelines for Spatial Planning published by DINOT in 2013
The indicator will be measured in 2016 and 2018 after one year of joint agenda approval and implementation See Anexo Referencia metodológica para medición de indicadores del marco lógico

No net loss in area or condition of each ecosystem

The base line for this indicator was estimated using low resolution satellite images However the project partially supported the acquisition of highresolution satellite images on 2015 This allowed the enforcement of a new and more detailed ecosystem surface measurement methodology in broad territories which will be the data source for various indicators to be included in the Monitoring and Evaluation System that is being designed It was considered as highly convenient to use the same data source for the calculation of various indicators Therefore a new base line was generated for this indicator See Annex Methodological Reference for logic framework indicators Anexo Referencia metodológica para indicadores del marco logico
To date the indicator was applied in Tacuarembó department target zone Northern Canyons in Río Negro department target zone Western Littoral and in the entire target zone Coastal lagoons For the rest of North Canyon Rivera the image processing is yet to be performed and for the area Montes del Queguay of Western Littoral images are to be acquired Complete results will be available towards the end of 2015 The chart below presents the results obtained on June 2015 The indicator will be calculated again on 2018
New base line

61100 110 ha

Incidence of Gleditsia triachanthos in Farrapos
140 49 ha
4061 80 ha
61100 70 ha

In 2014 approximately 600 ha of Esteros de Farrapos protected area were estimated to have incidence of invasive species Aiming to update the baseline new highresolution satellite images were acquired and a new methodology to estimate the indicator was proposed See Anexo Referencia metodológica para indicadores del marco lógico Base line values per coverage level are being adjusted during 2015 Afterwards the program for controlling invasive species will begin

Estrategia de difusión y concienciación publica sobre el SNAP y el enfoque de paisaje en la gestión fortalecida.
Publicación y acceso público de la información generada relativa al SNAP.
Fortalecimiento de la fiscalización de las áreas protegidas de las zonas meta del proyecto.
Generación de información sobre calidad del agua en zonas meta del proyecto.
Elaboración de herramientas para la evaluación y monitoreo del estado de conservación en predios privados.

Se fortaleció la estrategia de difusión y del SNAP y su enfoque de paisaje en la gestión para la concienciación de la población en general y de los tomadores de decisión, 1. mediante la elaboración del libro Primera Década del SNAP, 2. eventos de difusión en Montevideo y en todas las áreas meta (Litoral Oeste, Lagunas Costeras, Quebradas del Norte) con la participación de beneficiarios locales, 3. Fotorreportaje Flordelana sobre mujeres rurales del área protegida Valle del Lunarejo que trabajan la lana de amplia difusión en toda la región (https://stories.undp.org/tejedoras-del-cambio), 4. serie de televisión abierta "de la tierra al plato" dedicado a la cocina con recursos de áreas protegidas.
100% de la información general y de planificación y gestión del SNAP y 100% de la información relativa a planes de manejo incorporada el Sistema de información del SNAP.
Se han incorporado 3 nuevos guardaparques para la fiscalización de en valle del Lunarejo y Laguna Garzón.
Documento de calidad del agua y sedimentos en las cuencas de las lagunas costeras presentado en conjunto con la Universidad de la República y el departamento de Calidad Ambiental de DINAMA.
Protocolo para la evaluación rápida del estado de conservación e identificación de medidas de manejo orientadas a promover la conservación voluntaria en tierras privadas elaborado.
